properties.description: This policy denies creation of Azure PAAS services with exposed public endpoints.  This policy set includes the policy for the following services KeyVault, Storage accounts, AKS, Cosmos, SQL Servers, MariaDB, MySQL and Postgress.
properties.displayName: Public network access should be disabled for PAAS services

metadata.displayName: Public network access should be disabled for CosmosDB
metadata.description: This policy denies that  Cosmos database accounts  are created with out public network access is disabled.

metadata.displayName: Public network access should be disabled for MariaDB
metadata.description: This policy denies the creation of Maria DB accounts with exposed public endpoints

metadata.displayName: Public network access should be disabled for MySQL
metadata.description: This policy denies creation of MySql DB accounts with exposed public endpoints

metadata.displayName: Public network access should be disabled for PostgreSql
metadata.description: This policy denies creation of Postgre SQL DB accounts with exposed public endpoints

metadata.displayName: Public network access should be disabled for KeyVault
metadata.description: This policy denies creation of Key Vaults with IP Firewall exposed to all public endpoints

metadata.displayName: Public network access on Azure SQL Database should be disabled
metadata.description: This policy denies creation of Sql servers with exposed public endpoints

metadata.displayName: Public network access onStorage accounts should be disabled
metadata.description: This policy denies creation of storage accounts with IP Firewall exposed to all public endpoints

metadata.displayName: Public network access on AKS API should be disabled
metadata.description: This policy denies  the creation of  Azure Kubernetes Service non-private clusters

metadata.displayName: Public network access on Azure Cache for Redi should be disabled
metadata.description: Azure Cache for Redis should disable public network access

metadata.displayName: Azure Synapse workspaces should use private link, no deny in buildin policy
metadata.description: Azure Private Link lets you connect your virtual network to Azure services without a public IP address at the source or destination. The Private Link platform handles the connectivity between the consumer and services over the Azure backbone network. By mapping private endpoints to Azure Synapse workspace, data leakage risks are reduced. Learn more about private links at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/synapse-analytics/security/how-to-connect-to-workspace-with-private-links

metadata.displayName: Azure API for FHIR should use private link, no deny in buildin policy
metadata.description: Azure API for FHIR should have at least one approved private endpoint connection. Clients in a virtual network can securely access resources that have private endpoint connections through private links. For more information, visit: https://aka.ms/fhir-privatelink.
